quizSrc.term: What does HTML stand for?
Unlike earlier versions of HTML, HTML5 produces pages that look the same across all browsers. ( T/F)
What does FTP stand for?
What does HTTP stand for?
Which of the following is part of a URL?A. protocolB. editorC. hosting service
The Internet is a type ofA. Wide Area NetworkB. Hypertext NetworkC. Local Area Network

What is the Request/Response Cycle?A. The process that happens when a server requests a page and a client responds with the appropriate filesB. The process that happens when a HTML5 is created with an editorC. The process that happens when a client requests a page and a server responds with the appropriate files
quizSrc.definition: C. The process that happens when a client requests a page and a server responds with the appropriate files

quizSrc.term: A ________________________ is a computer that is in charge of handling resource requests from multiple computers.
The Domain Name Service looks up the domain and returns theA. IP addressB. serverC. hostD. document

Which organization is responsible for assigning top-level domain names?A. Internet Corporation for Assigned Number and Names ( ICANN)B. Internet Domain Name Server (IDNS)C. World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)
quizSrc.definition: A. Internet Corporation for Assigned Number and Names ( ICANN)

quizSrc.term: The Request-Response Cycle...A. is an outdated process used by HTML 4.1B. may require several iterations of the Request - Response CycleC. is performed once for each requested page
quizSrc.definition: B. may require several iterations of the Request - Response Cycle

quizSrc.term: What does LAN stand for?
What does WAN stand for?
Which is the correct file extension for a web page?A. .pptB. .docC. .htmlD. .txt
HTML uses _________ to annotate documents. This is a way of marking up the content to identify specific HTML elements.
The original developers of HTML were opposed to the addition of tags for graphical images. ( T/F )
The first graphical browser was.... (please use one word answer)
What are proprietary tags?A. Tags that work only on certain browsersB. Tags used to define ownership of the contentC. Tags that displayed copyright information
quizSrc.definition: A. Tags that work only on certain browsers

quizSrc.term: Which of these tags breaks the tenet of the separation of content and layout?A. bodyB. h1C. fontD. br
Which of the following are browsers?A. Chrome , Firefox , SafariB. Firefox, Windows, ChromeC. Safari, Mac, Sublime, Chrome

A basic functionality of browsers is to translate HTML documents into viewable webpages. ( T/F)

The predecessor of the internet wasA. DARPAB. CompuServeC. ArpanetD. Al Gore

Which of the following is an example of a top-level domain?A. .bizB. umich.eduC. mysite

Semantics isA. the practice of giving content on the page meaning and structure by using proper elementB. the set of rules that defines the combinations of symbols that are considered to be a correctly structured document or fragment in that languageC. circular
quizSrc.definition: A. the practice of giving content on the page meaning and structure by using proper element

quizSrc.term: Semantic code describes the ___ of content on a page, regardless of the style or appearance of that content.A. numberB. valueC. language
Using tags that have semantic meaningA. increases accessibility and improve search engine optimizationB. increases search engine optimizationC. breaks the seperation between content and layout
quizSrc.definition: A. increases accessibility and improve search engine optimization

quizSrc.term: Every well-formed HTML document should include:A. doctype, head, bodyB. doctype, header, bodyC. header, nav, footerD. alt text

What is wrong with the following code?A. This link doesn't provide any way to click on the link.B. The anchor link is self-closing. Remove the and the code will work.C. The alt text attribute is missing from the tagD. This code is semantically and syntactically correct.
quizSrc.definition: A. This link doesn't provide any way to click on the link.

Inline-level elements begin on a new line (T/F)
A <div> block is an inline-level element ( T/F )
A <span> block is an inline-level element (T/F)

Which tag represents a line break (new line)?A.
B. C. D.

Which of the following code is the correct way to link to an email address?A. EmailB. EmailC. EmailD. Email
Which HTML element will number items for you?a. <ul>b. <dl>c. <num>d. <ol>

The reverse attribute allows a list to appear in a reverse order in an unordered list. ( T/F )

The tags to create definitions are;A. <dl>, <dt>, <dd>B. <dl>, <term>, <def>C. <def>, <dt>, <dd>D. <def>, <dt>, <li>
What should target = "_blank" do when included in a link tag?A. Opens the link in a new tab or windowB. Opens the link in a a tab called "_blank"C. This is not a valid expression
quizSrc.definition: A. Opens the link in a new tab or window

quizSrc.term: In order for the element to work, a src attribute and value must be included to specify the source of the image. ( T/F )
The alt text of an image should describe the appearance of an image ( T/F )

When should an image have null (empty) alt text (alt - "")A. When the image is black and whiteB. When the image is complexC. When the image is decorativeD. When the image already displays descriptive text
quizSrc.definition: C. When the image is decorative

quizSrc.term: What are the elements to help organize the data and structure of a table?A. <caption>, <head>, <body>, <foot>B. <caption>, <thead>, <tbody>, <foot>C. <caption>, <thead>, <tbody>, <tfoot>D. <caption>, <thead>, <body>, <foot>

quizSrc.term: To access your cPanel account, you need ...A. a username and password from your hosting serverB. the username and password for your computerC. the port number for your account
quizSrc.definition: A. a username and password from your hosting server

quizSrc.term: To publish your site online you needA. a domain name and hosting serviceB. an account through work or schoolC. a client
quizSrc.definition: A. a domain name and hosting service

Which of the following is not an option for specifying a color in CSS3?A. hexadecimalB. binaryC. rgbaD. color nameE. rgb
If your body tag uses the style attribute style="text-align:center", you can overwrite that property by using the CSS3 rule. ( T/F )body{ text-align: left;}

What is wrong with the following rule?body{ color: #000000; background-color:#FFFFFF; font-family: Times, Arial, Cursive;}A. This is a valid ruleB. You can't specify three options for font-familyC. You can't specify three styles in a single rule
quizSrc.definition: A. This is a valid rule

quizSrc.term: Assume the following rule is the only one that styles the body element:body{ font-family: Cursive, Helvetica, Verdana;}What happens if the browser doesn't support any of these font families?A. The text will be displayed in the default browser font-familyB. The text will not be displayedC. The text will be displayed in Cursive
quizSrc.definition: A. The text will be displayed in the default browser font-family

quizSrc.term: The browser defaults override rules specified in an external style sheets. ( T/F )

Using the code below, will the body of the page have the background-color defined in the file style.css or the background color define in the <style> tag?<head> <meta charset = "UTF-8"> <title>Test code</title> <link rel "stylesheet" href = "style.css"> <style> body{ background-color: #44CCDD; } </style></head>A. <style>B. style.css
Internal styling (rules specified in the <head> section) override rules specified with the style attribute in a tag. ( T/F )
The default display value for <a> element is:A. inlineB. inline-blockC. blockD. none
The default display value for <span> is:A. inline-blockB. noneC. inlineD. block
A block element takes up the full width of it's parent, even if the content is smaller than the parent. So two block elements at the same will not be side-by-side. ( T/F )
Inline elements take up the full width of the browser, even if the content is smaller than the browser size. ( T/ F)
Which CSS3 property is used to center text? (Provide on the property, not the value!)

Which of the following is the best way to convey that your text has special meaning?A. Using a larger font size to signify the important textB. Using semantic tags in addition to color and/or font.C. Using a combination of font size and color to signify the important textD. Using colors to signify the important text
quizSrc.definition: B. Using semantic tags in addition to color and/or font.

quizSrc.term: Given this rule:div{ border-width:10px 5px;}what is the width of the right border?
The margin is the space between elements. (T/F)
Padding is...A. The space between an element and its borderB. The space between two elementsC. The space reserved for an element
quizSrc.definition: A. The space between an element and its border

quizSrc.term: The padding and margin properties can be styled with unique colors. (T/F)
How much horizontal space ("width") will this div use?div{ width:50px; padding: 10px; margin: 5px; border: 2px;}
How much vertical space ("height") will this div use?div{ height:50px; padding: 5px 10px; margin: 5px; border: 2px;}
Which property can remove the underline from links? (Only provide the property name; do not give it a value.)
The property/value pair list-style-type:upper-roman;is best used to visually alter:A. ordered listsB. unordered listsC. both ordered and unordered lists
Descendant selectorsnav a{ ....}are more specific than child selectorsnav>a{ ....}( T/F )
The id selectors are part of the DOM.(T/F)
The class selectors are part of the DOM ( T/F )

What is true about this code?

....

A. It is not legal to have two words ("fancy box") within the class.B. The fancy styling will take precedence over the box styling.C. The box styling will take precedence over the fancy styling.D. From this code, you can't know which styling will take precedence.
quizSrc.definition: D. From this code, you can't know which styling will take precedence.

quizSrc.term: This is probably a typo, why?.body{ margin: 10px;}A. The period in front of the word body means the browser will look for a class called body, not the element.B. The period in front of the word body means the browser will look for an id called body, not the element.
quizSrc.definition: A. The period in front of the word body means the browser will look for a class called body, not the element.

What is the correct HTML for referring to an external style sheet?A. <link rel="css" href="mystyle.css">B. <link rel="stylesheet" href="mystyle.css">C. <link rel="stylesheet" src="mystyle.css">D. <style src="mystyle.css"></style>

What is the correct HTML for referring to an external style sheet stored in a subfolder called css?A. <link rel="css/stylesheet" href="css/mystyle.css"> B. <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/mystyle.css"> C. <style src="css/mystyle.css">D. <link rel="css/stylesheet" href="mystyle.css">
The link to the external style sheet should be in the:A. <header>B. <head>C. <div>D. <footer>
Which CSS property controls the text size?A. text-sizeB. text-styleC. font-sizeD. font-height
How do you display hyperlinks without an underline?A. a {text-decoration:no-underline;}B. a {underline:none;}C. a { text-decoration:none; }D. a {decoration:no-underline;}
In the following code snippet, what value is given for the left margin?margin: 5px 10px 3px 8px;A. 5pxB. 10pxC. 3pxD. 8px
The # symbol specifies that the selector is a/anA. tagB. idC. firstD. class

Which of the following would be used to create class called button which has a width of 750px, a height of 30px and the color of the text is black?A. #button { height: 30px; width: 750px; text: black; }B. .button { height: 30px; width: 750px; color: black; }C. #button { height: 30px; width: 750px; color: black; }D. .button { height: 30px; width: 750px; text: black; }
Which snippet of CSS is commonly used to center an element horizontally?A. site-align: center;B. margin: auto 0;C. margin: 0 auto;D. margin: center;
A default style sheet is used to:A. Eliminate differences in browser default stylingB. Insert the prefixes needed to support different browsers
quizSrc.definition: A. Eliminate differences in browser default styling

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is NOT a browser prefix?A. edgeB. mozC. webkitD. o
Descendant selectorsnav a{ ....}are more general than child selectorsnav>a{ ....}(T/F)
How much width will this div occupy?div{ width:100px; padding: 10px; margin: 5px; border: 2px;}
The style tag and the style attribute are interchangeable -- this means that you accomplish the same effect with both.
Using only a default style sheet..A. will typically make your page look worseB. will typically make your page look great
quizSrc.definition: A. will typically make your page look worse

quizSrc.term: The default value for the position property is:A. absoluteB. relative C. fixedD. static

What is wrong with this code?div{ position: static; left: 10px;}A. The code works, but the left property is not necessary since static elements don't allow offsetsB. There is nothing wrong with this codeC. "relative" is not a valid option for positon
quizSrc.definition: A. The code works, but the left property is not necessary since static elements don't allow offsets

quizSrc.term: If you want your navigation bar to remain visible, even when the user scrolls downward, you should use which type of positioning?A. relativeB. fixedC. absoluteD. static

Which of the following is the proper syntax for a pseudo-class?A. selector->pseudo-class {  property:value;}B. selector::pseudo-class {  property:value;}C. :pseudo-class {  property:value;}D. selector:pseudo-class {  property:value;}
Which of the following rules styles the first paragraph in each div?A. div p{  color: blue;} B. div p:first-child {  color: blue;} C. div:first-child p{  color: blue;} D. div > p{  color: blue;}
Which CSS3 property allows you to change property values smoothly over a given duration?A. focusB. transistionC. changeD. hover

Sometimes elements overlap one another. Which property specifies the stacking order of the elements? (A high value means it is more likely to be place in front of another.) ONLY PROVIDE THE PROPERTY, NOT A VALUE.

Which rule will change the text color of p elements with the class "highlight" when hovered over?A. .highlight::hover{  color:green;}B. .highlight:hover{  color:green;}C. p:hover > highlight{  color:green;}D. p:hover > highlight{  color:green;}
What are the four principles of Accessibility?A. USEB. POURC. PORED. WEBAIM

What is wrong with this code?div{ position: relative; left: 10px;}A. The code works, but the left property is not necessary since static elements don't allow offsetsB. There is nothing wrong with this codeC. "relative" is not a valid option for positon
quizSrc.definition: B. There is nothing wrong with this code

quizSrc.term: Every valid web page can be represented as a tree. This tree is referred to as theA. JavaScriptB. APIC. DOM
JavaScript uses what kind of interface to access the DOM structure?A. CSS3B. an APIC. HTML5

Which of these is not valid? (Hint, pay attention to if the method should return one thing, or many things...)A. document.getElementsByTagName(tagName)B. document.getElementsByClassName(className)C. document.getElementsById(idName)
Which of the following is not a valid method for generating output to the screen?A. document.writeB. printC. alertD. prompt
Which of these options does NOT require the use of parentheses?A. console.logB. promptC. alertD. document.writeE. innerHTML
Which of the following does not generate output directly to the screen?A. console.log(message);B. document.write(message);C. element.innerHTML = message;
How does prompt differ from alert?A. Only alert uses parentheses.B. The alert will return a value, prompt does not.C. Only prompt uses parentheses.D. The prompt will return a value, alert does not.
quizSrc.definition: D. The prompt will return a value, alert does not.

quizSrc.term: Variables allow you to save data. ( T/F )
In JavaScript the keyword ___________ is used to declare a variable.

What does it mean that variables are case-sensitive?A. That all variables must use uppercase lettersB. That all variables must use lowercase lettersC. That the computer does not think that the variables name and Name are the same thing.
quizSrc.definition: C. That the computer does not think that the variables name and Name are the same thing.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is not a valid variable name?A. variableOneB. oneVariableC. variable1D. 1variable
Which of the following is not a valid variable name?A. variable-2B. variable_2C. variable$2

What does mnemonic mean?A. That variable names should help describe the value being stored.B. That variable names should be as short as possible, preferably with no more than two or three characters.C. That variable names should start with lowercase letters and use uppercase letters if the variable has multiple parts, e.g. firstName.
quizSrc.definition: A. That variable names should help describe the value being stored.

quizSrc.term: What is wrong with this code?var name = "Mike";"Colleen" = name;A. It is illegal to change the value stored in a variable B. This code is illegal and it doesn't make sense to have a non-variable ( also called a constant) in the left-hand side (LHS) of an assignment statementC. The variable declaration is illegal
quizSrc.definition: B. This code is illegal and it doesn't make sense to have a non-variable ( also called a constant) in the left-hand side (LHS) of an assignment statement

quizSrc.term: What value is stored in name if the person hits the Cancel button on a prompt?var name = prompt("What is your name?");
What value is stored in name if the person hits the Okay button on a prompt before entering anything?var name = prompt("What is your name?");A. an empty string("")B. undefinedC. exception
To create a String variable, use quotes around the value you want to save. ( T/F )
Boolean variables store either true or false. ( T/ F)
When a function returns a node from the DOM, it is of typeA. NumberB. ObjectC. StringD. Boolean
A function that wants to return multiple values at once (such as document.getElementsByTagName) will return a/anA. NumberB. ArrayC. String
Which of the following is not a valid operator?A. +=B. ==C. ++D. =+E. --
What value is returned by 9 % 5?

What is the difference between == and === ?A. The == operator only checks for equivalent values, not equivalent type too.B. The == operator is the assignment operator, while === is the equality operator.C. The === operator only checks for equivalent values, not equivalent type too.
quizSrc.definition: A. The == operator only checks for equivalent values, not equivalent type too.

quizSrc.term: What is the logical operator for AND?
JavaScript code must be placed in the <head> section of the document. ( T/F )
Which tag is used to let the browser know that it is about to see JavaScript code?A. scriptB. headC. js

Which is the correct syntax to change the contents of the HTML element below?

This is a quiz.

A. document.getElementById('quiz').innerHTML ="New content!!";B. #quiz.innerHTML="New content!!";C. document.getElementsByTagName('p').innerHTML ="New content!!";D. quiz.innerHTML="New content!";
Where can you put JavaScript?A) In the <head> sectionB) In the <body> sectionC) In an external fileD) In B) and C) aboveE) In A), B) and C) above

Which attribute is used to link to an external JavaScript file?A. href; e.g., href = "extFile.js"B. src; e.g., src = "extFile.js"C. file; e.g., file = "extFile.js"D. script; e.g., script = "extFile.js"
Which word is used to define a function in JavaScript?A. functionB. funcC. define

Which of the following best defines the relationship between defining a function and calling a function?A. A function can be defined multiple times in a single fileB. A function can be called multiple times in a single file.
quizSrc.definition: B. A function can be called multiple times in a single file.

Consider the following code:

This is paragraph one

This is paragraph two

The function Hello() will be called every time:A) The user clicks on any paragraph on the pageB) The user places his/her mouse over any paragraph on the pageC) The user clicks on the second paragraph on the pageD) A and CE) The function is never called.

What is wrong with this function definition?function Hello();{ alert("Hello"); document.write("Hello on the screen");}A. The fact that you are outputting the message twiceB. You can't use document.write after using an alert.C. The semicolon after Hello()

Which is the correct syntax to change the contents of the HTML element below?

This is a quiz.

A. document.getElementsByTagName('p').innerHTML = "New content!";B. document.getElementById('quiz').innerHTML("New content!");C. document.getElementsByTagName('p').innerHTML("New content!");D. document.getElementById('quiz').innerHTML = "New content!";
Where can you put JavaScript?A. In the head and body sectionB. Just in the <head> sectionC. Just in the <body> section
quizSrc.definition: A. In the head and body section

quizSrc.term: Built-in JavaScript functions (alert, prompt, etc) cannot be mixed in with other HTML code unless you use the script tag.
Which word is used to define a function in JavaScript?A. funcB. functionC. scriptD. define
If a function is defined twice, the first declaration will be called when used. ( T/F )
A function can be called multiple times in a single file.(T/F)
You can define a function without calling it. (T/F)
You can call a function without it being defined. ( T/F )
Conditional statements change the flow of execution in a program — the "next" line of code in the program is not always the next one that is executed. (T/F)

Assume you have a page with four paragraph tags, one of which has the id "second". What is the proper JavaScript code to change the content of that paragraph to "What does the Fox say?"Note:The quotes shouldn't be part of the value.Please end the line of code with a semicolon.Note, you can't assume that this is the second paragraph.

Assume you have a page with four paragraph tags. What is the proper JavaScript code to change the content of the second paragraph to "What does the Fox say?"A. document.getElementsByTagName('p')[1].innerHTML = "What does the Fox say?"B. document.getElementById('second').innerHTML = "What does the Fox say?"C. document.getElementByTagName('p')[2].innerHTML = "What does the Fox say?"D. document.getElementById('p')[2].innerHTML = "What does the Fox say?"E. document.getElementsByTagName('p').innerHTML = "What does the Fox say?"
How do you properly access the first element in an array variable named "fruit"A. fruit[0]B. fruit[1]C. [fruit]0D. fruit_0E. None of the above.
Which of the following is NOT a fluid measurementA. pxB. %C. remD. em

Responsive Web Design is...A. Designing pages for multiple platforms by incorporating fluid measurements and varying CSS rules.B. Designing pages for the mobile view.C. Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop)
quizSrc.definition: A. Designing pages for multiple platforms by incorporating fluid measurements and varying CSS rules.

quizSrc.term: Adaptive design with dynamic serving is....A. Designing pages for multiple platforms by incorporating fluid measurements and varying CSS rules.B. Designing pages for the mobile view.C. Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop)
quizSrc.definition: C. Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop)

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is a true statement about using a separate "m." site for your content?A. It is difficult to keep multiple versions of your site consistent. Any updates must be made in multiple places.B. Some search engines require a .m version of your site.C. Users have control over which version of the page they can see, regardless of the device they are using.
quizSrc.definition: A. It is difficult to keep multiple versions of your site consistent. Any updates must be made in multiple places.

quizSrc.term: The mobile version of your web page should have the same capabilities of every other version of your site. ( T/F )
The mobile version of your web page should have the same layout of every other version of your site. ( T/F )
Which fluid measurement type returns a percentage of the viewport width?
Which fluid measurement type returns a percentage of the viewport height?
The fluid measurement % can only be used on non-textual elements ( T/F )
Responsive sites can have a mixture of fluid and absolute measurements. ( T/F )

Which of the following statements best describes what pixels, ems, and rems have in common?A. They are all units of measurement used to define the length of elements on a webpage.B. They are all fluid units of measurement that define the screen resolution of a page.C. They are all fluid units of measurement used to define the length of elements on a webpage.
quizSrc.definition: A. They are all units of measurement used to define the length of elements on a webpage.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following measurements is relative to the size of its parent element ?A. pxB. emC. rem

If you have an element with the font size of 32px, and a child element inside with a a font-size set to 2em, what is the font size of the child in px? (Provide a number only, not the measurement too.)
An _______ is the size of type as computed relative to the type size of the parent element.
A _______ is the size of type as computed relative to the type size of the top level "html" element rather than a parent element.
Which measurement is easier and comfortable for the designer/developer to use when coding their CSS but does not provide the best experience for the user?
1 _____ = 1% of viewport height
Consider the following CSS rules:div{ width: 80%;}@media all and (min-width: 500px){ div{ width: 25%; }}What is the width of any div elements on a 350px screen?A. 25%B. 80%C. 100%
Consider the following CSS rules:div{ width: 80%;}@media all and (min-width: 500px){ div{ width: 25%; }}What is the width of any div elements on a 750px screen?A. 80%B. 25%C. 100%

Consider the following CSS rules:@media all and (min-width: 500px){ div{ width: 25%; }}div{  width: 80%;}What is the width of any div elements on a 750px screen?A. 100%B. 25%C. 80%D. The div won't display since media queries must go at the bottom of the screen.

Consider the following CSS rule:div{ width: 80%;}@media print { div{ width: 25%; }}Which of the following is a true statement?A. The div elements will have a width of 80% only when the page is printedB. The div elements will have a width of 25% only when the page is printedC. The div elements will only visible only when the page is printed
quizSrc.definition: B. The div elements will have a width of 25% only when the page is printed

quizSrc.term: Which of the following code segments will keep people from being able to zoom in or out on your content?A. <meta name = 'viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1, maximum-scale = 1'>B. <meta name = 'viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1'>C. It is impossible to lock the zoom ability
Which term is used to define the different viewport sizes that trigger media queries?A. breakpointB. metaC. media-query sizeD. wireframe
Wireframes should...A. specify the layout, color, and content of your pagesB. specify the layout of your pagesC. specify the layout and content of your pages
quizSrc.definition: C. specify the layout and content of your pages

quizSrc.term: A key component of your wireframes should testA. interactionB. color schemesC. code syntax
Give an example screen width size for a mobile phone using pixels. (Just provide a number, and not the px!!!)

Which of the following is a deprecated media type -- meaning they are omitted in later versions. (You will need to search for this online it is not in the notes. But a lot of what you do with web design will require a little searching!)A. allB. brailleC. speechD. printE. screen
Consider the following code using Bootstrap 3:<div class = "col-sm-2 col-lg-4">In an xs viewport the div will be _____ columns wide.
Consider the following code using Bootstrap 3:<div class = "col-md-3 col-lg-7">In a sm viewport the div will be _____ columns wide.
Consider the following code using Bootstrap 3:<div class = "col-md-3 col-lg-7">In a md viewport the div will be _____ columns wide.
Consider the following code using Bootstrap 3:<div class = "col-sm-2 col-lg-4">In a lg viewport the div will be _____ columns wide.
True or False, Boostrap is mobile-first
The Bootstrap 3 grid system is based on how many columns?
A standard navigation pill is created with:A. <ul class="nav pills">B. <ul class="nav-pills">C. <ul class="nav nav-pills">D. <nav class="nav nav-pills">
True or False, the Bootstrap grid system works across multiple devices.

Which of the following bootstrap classes are used to create a justified tabs navigation? (Reminder, "justified" means that they grow/shrink to take up the full width of the screen.)A. <ul class="nav nav-tabs justified">B. <ul class="nav nav-tabs">C. <ul class="nav nav-tabs nav-stacked">D. <ul class="nav nav-tabs nav-justified">
Which of the following bootstrap classes are used to add a dropdown menu?A. <nav class="dropdown-menu">B. <ul class="dropdown-menu">C. <ul class="nav nav-pills dropdown">
True or false, Bootstrap is a framework for back-end web development.
True or false, Bootstrap is a framework for front-end web development.
Bootstrap uses ...A. CSSB. JavaScriptC. HTMLD. HTML & CSSE. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

Which of the following is a benefit of using the Bootstrap CDN?A. You always are linked to the latest Bootstrap code.B. You are able to customize the Bootstrap values which you can not do with a local version of the code.C. Using the CDN is the only way to use Bootstrap for free.
quizSrc.definition: A. You always are linked to the latest Bootstrap code.

quizSrc.term: True or False, with Bootstrap you need to change your HTML code to utilize the Bootstrap classes.

If you are using an editor (not CodePen) you will need to reference Bootstrap resources where?A. In the body with a link to jQuery and JavaScriptB. In the body section - with a link to the css and js filesC. In the head element - with a link to the css - and again at the bottom of the body with a link to jQuery and JavaScriptD. In the head element - with a link to the css and js files
quizSrc.definition: C. In the head element - with a link to the css - and again at the bottom of the body with a link to jQuery and JavaScript

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is NOT a fluid measurementA. %B. pxC. remD. emE. vw
Designing multiple pages, one for each type of major device (phone, tablet, laptop, and desktop) is calledA. Adaptive DesignB. Multi-site designC. the .m paradigm

Here, there.. How big is the font?

What is the font-size of the span element in px? (Looking for a numeric answer only, no measurements.)
Consider the following CSS rules:div{ width: 25%;}@media all and (min-width: 500px){ div{ width: 50%; }}What is the width of any div elements on a 450px screen?A. 25%B. 50%C. 100%
Which Bootstrap class will apply a striped look to a Bootstrap table?

If you created a site with a Bootstrap drop-down menu and it is visible, but not functioning, the problem is probably with...A. The link to the Bootstrap HTML code.B. The link to the Bootstrap CSS code.C. The link to the Bootstrap JavaScript code.
quizSrc.definition: C. The link to the Bootstrap JavaScript code.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is a recommended way to incorporate Bootstrap into your code?A. Use a link to the Content Delivery NetworkB. Use a link to the Bootstrap 3 site.
quizSrc.definition: A. Use a link to the Content Delivery Network
